DateText: Painting: 12th century AH/AD 18th century; Calligraphy: 990 AH/AD 1582-1583
Title: Calligraphic Verses
Description: This manuscript leaf, Walters W.713, is a sample of calligraphy in Nasta'liq script quoting verses by the Persian poet Sa'di Shirazi (died 691 AH/AD 1292). These verses were executed in Samarqand by Muhammad Amin ibn Baba Jan in 990 AH/AD 1582-1583. The blue, gray, and salmon borders are decorated with illuminated floral motifs.
Keywords: Indian; Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Illustration; Miniature; Painting; India; Iran
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Indian
